pullRequest.title: Sync to Image Location and Privacy Scanner 1.1
pullRequest.bodyText:
I updated a few image scanner types and faster/smaller.better library upgrades to ILS which bumped the version to 1.1.  This also includes minor help updates, formatting, and the README documents in the master branch of the main repo at https://github.com/veggiespam/ImageLocationScanner .  With respect to the help docs, I believe I created them in the correct location, but I am unsure how to generate everything.
Additionally, from the gradle build process created by the ZAP team in zap-extensions, the ticket for zaproxy/zaproxy#4295 may now be ready for promotion.  I had to drop the project temporarily and appreciate your team continuing with the efforts.
Please let me know of any mods/updates needed to get the updates into ZAP.  Thanks.

Merge pull request #1 from zaproxy/master

catch up to master
first attempt at upgrading ZAP's ILS to v1.1
revert - change not needed for build

nodes.bodyText: This is redundant with the note above(?).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -10,15 +10,16 @@

Image Location and Privacy Scanner

The following passive scan rule is included in this add-on:

Image Location and Privacy Scanner

-

Passively scans for GPS location exposure in images during normal security -assessments of websites. Image Location Scanner assists in situations where -end users may post profile images and possibly give away their home location, -e.g. a dating site or children's chatroom. A whitepaper on this can be found -at http://veggiespam.com/ils/

+

Passively scans for GPS location and other privacy-related exposures in images during normal security assessments of websites. Image Location and Privacy Scanner (ILS) assists in situations where end users may post profile images and possibly give away their home location, e.g. a dating site or children's chatroom.

+

More information on this topic, including a white paper based on a real-world site audit given as a presentation at the New Jersey chapter of the OWASP organization, can be found at https://www.veggiespam.com/ils/ .

+

This software finds the GPS information inside of Exif tags, IPTC codes, and proprietary camera codes. Then, the Image Location and Privacy Scanner flags the findings in the ZAP Alerts list as an information message. It would be up to the auditor to determine if location exposure is truly a security risk based on context.

Note: In order for this scanner to operate images cannot be filtered out via the settings "Global Exclude URL" or the Session Properties for "Exclude from Proxy".

- +
    +
  • Before ZAP 2.7.x, you must manually enabled image scanning with: Tools → Options → Display → Process images in the HTTP requests/responses pane.
    • +
  • If you have images disabled in Global Exclude URL, then any passive image scanner, like ILS, will be unable to see the images and report on privacy issues.
